trans-unit.source: How to Set Up Computer for Media Services Development with .NET
trans-unit.target: How to Set Up Computer for Media Services Development with .NET

trans-unit.source: Learn about the prerequisites for Media Services using the Media Services SDK for .NET. Also learn how to create a Visual Studio app.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the prerequisites for Media Services using the Media Services SDK for .NET. Also learn how to create a Visual Studio app.

trans-unit.source: Media Services development with .NET
trans-unit.target: Media Services development with .NET

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses how to start developing Media Services applications using .NET.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses how to start developing Media Services applications using .NET.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Media Services .NET SDK library enables you to program against Media Services using .NET.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Media Services .NET SDK library enables you to program against Media Services using .NET.

trans-unit.source: To make it even easier to develop with .NET, the Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions library is provided.
trans-unit.target: To make it even easier to develop with .NET, the Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions library is provided.

trans-unit.source: This library contains a set of extension methods and helper functions that will simplify your .NET code.
trans-unit.target: This library contains a set of extension methods and helper functions that will simplify your .NET code.

trans-unit.source: Both libraries are available through NuGet and GitHub.
trans-unit.target: Both libraries are available through NuGet and GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account in a new or existing Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account in a new or existing Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See the topic <link><linkText>How to Create a Media Services Account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See the topic <link><linkText>How to Create a Media Services Account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Operating Systems: Windows 7, Windows 2008 R2, or Windows 8.
trans-unit.target: Operating Systems: Windows 7, Windows 2008 R2, or Windows 8.

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework 4.5.
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework 4.5.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012, or Visual Studio 2010 SP1 (Professional, Premium, Ultimate, or Express).
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012, or Visual Studio 2010 SP1 (Professional, Premium, Ultimate, or Express).

trans-unit.source: Create and configure a Visual Studio project
trans-unit.target: Create and configure a Visual Studio project

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to create a project in Visual Studio and set it up for Media Services development.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to create a project in Visual Studio and set it up for Media Services development.

trans-unit.source: In this case the project is a C# Windows console application, but the same setup steps shown here apply to other types of projects you can create for Media Services applications (for example, a Windows Forms application or an ASP.NET Web application).
trans-unit.target: In this case the project is a C# Windows console application, but the same setup steps shown here apply to other types of projects you can create for Media Services applications (for example, a Windows Forms application or an ASP.NET Web application).

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to use NuGet to add Media Services .NET SDK and other dependent libraries.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to use NuGet to add Media Services .NET SDK and other dependent libraries.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can get the latest Media Services .NET SDK bits from GitHub (<link><linkText>github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-media-services</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-media-services-extensions</linkText><title></title></link>, build the solution, and add the references to the client project.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can get the latest Media Services .NET SDK bits from GitHub (<link><linkText>github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-media-services</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-media-services-extensions</linkText><title></title></link>, build the solution, and add the references to the client project.

trans-unit.source: Note that all the necessary dependencies get downloaded and extracted automatically.
trans-unit.target: Note that all the necessary dependencies get downloaded and extracted automatically.

trans-unit.source: Create a new C# Console Application in Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio 2010 SP1.
trans-unit.target: Create a new C# Console Application in Visual Studio 2013, Visual Studio 2012 or Visual Studio 2010 SP1.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, Location, and Solution name, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, Location, and Solution name, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Build the solution.
trans-unit.target: Build the solution.

trans-unit.source: Use NuGet to install and add Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions.
trans-unit.target: Use NuGet to install and add Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions.

trans-unit.source: Installing this package, also installs Media Services .NET SDK and adds all other required dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Installing this package, also installs Media Services .NET SDK and adds all other required dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you have the newest version of NuGet installed.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you have the newest version of NuGet installed.

trans-unit.source: For more information and installation instructions, see <link><linkText>NuGet</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information and installation instructions, see <link><linkText>NuGet</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the name of the project and choose Manage NuGet packages ….
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the name of the project and choose Manage NuGet packages ….

trans-unit.source: The Manage NuGet Packages dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The Manage NuGet Packages dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: In the Online gallery, search for Azure MediaServices Extensions, choose Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions, and then click the Install button.
trans-unit.target: In the Online gallery, search for Azure MediaServices Extensions, choose Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions, and then click the Install button.

trans-unit.source: The project is modified and references to the Media Services .NET SDK Extensions, Media Services .NET SDK, and other dependent assemblies are added.
trans-unit.target: The project is modified and references to the Media Services .NET SDK Extensions, Media Services .NET SDK, and other dependent assemblies are added.

trans-unit.source: To promote a cleaner development environment, consider enabling NuGet Package Restore.
trans-unit.target: To promote a cleaner development environment, consider enabling NuGet Package Restore.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>NuGet Package Restore"</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>NuGet Package Restore"</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Add a reference to System.Configuration assembly.
trans-unit.target: Add a reference to System.Configuration assembly.

trans-unit.source: This assembly contains the System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager class that is used to access configuration files (for example, App.config).
trans-unit.target: This assembly contains the System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager class that is used to access configuration files (for example, App.config).

trans-unit.source: To add references using the Manage References dialog, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To add references using the Manage References dialog, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the project name.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the project name.

trans-unit.source: Then, select Add and References.
trans-unit.target: Then, select Add and References.

trans-unit.source: The Manage References dialog appears.
trans-unit.target: The Manage References dialog appears.

trans-unit.source: Under .NET framework assemblies, find and select the System.Configuration assembly.
trans-unit.target: Under .NET framework assemblies, find and select the System.Configuration assembly.

trans-unit.source: Press OK.
trans-unit.target: Press OK.

trans-unit.source: Open the App.config file (add the file to your project if it was not added by default) and add an appSettings section to the file.
trans-unit.target: Open the App.config file (add the file to your project if it was not added by default) and add an appSettings section to the file.

trans-unit.source: Set the values for your Azure Media Services account name and account key, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: Set the values for your Azure Media Services account name and account key, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: To obtain the account name and account key information, open the Azure Management Portal, select your media services account and click the MANAGE KEYS button.
trans-unit.target: To obtain the account name and account key information, open the Azure Management Portal, select your media services account and click the MANAGE KEYS button.

trans-unit.source: <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="MediaServicesAccountName" value="Media-Services-Account-Name" /> <add key="MediaServicesAccountKey" value="Media-Services-Account-Key" /> </appSettings> </configuration>
trans-unit.target: <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="MediaServicesAccountName" value="Media-Services-Account-Name" /> <add key="MediaServicesAccountKey" value="Media-Services-Account-Key" /> </appSettings> </configuration>

trans-unit.source: Overwrite the existing using statements at the beginning of the Program.cs file with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Overwrite the existing using statements at the beginning of the Program.cs file with the following code.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you are ready to start developing a Media Services application.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you are ready to start developing a Media Services application.
